column1: would've been gone first ball! Slower and fuller on the stumps, defended into the off side for a quick single. A direct hit from short mid-off at the bowler's end and Campbell would've been walking back
full on the stumps, hint of movement away to square the batsman up, squirted back
gets half a stride in and bunts it into the off side with soft hands
gentle outswing from off-stump, defended
opened up by the late movement again, defended back
nice and full on the stumps, eased back
hits the deck hard with a length delivery on middle, defended
length ball that nips away a hint from middle, is besides the line as he defends
gentle bunt to Porterfield at short mid-off for a quick single
nice and full on the stumps, defended back with soft hands
overpitched and dispatched! Full on off, he brings out his wrists into play to whip this wide of midwicket
worked nicely into the gap past midwicket, aggressive running
works this wide of the short midwicket fielder
beauty! Slants across, he prods forward but plays down the wrong line. Beaten
rasping straight drive. Too full and he brought out the full face to lace it back
bunts this length ball to cover point
prods forward, gets a thick inside edge past leg stump
eased down to mid-on for a quick single
short of length on middle, defended back
punched on the up between cover and mid-off, good work by Joshua Little
slips this length ball on middle and leg, tucked to deep square leg
driven firmly to cover
shapes away off the seam to beat the outside edge as he prods forward
helps this short ball along to fine leg
gets well forward and defends
this one nips back in from length outside off, tucked to the leg side
gets a thick outside edge to square third man. Was looking to punch on the up through point
turns this to the leg side off a length on middle
prods forward but is late on it, zips past the outside edge.
stays right behind the line and defends
touch ahead of length on off, defended back
gentle dab with an angled bat to third man
tucks this to the leg side, looks for a single but is sen back
looks to flay this through cover, beaten as this nips away
driven firmly but this is an excellent stop by Tucker at extra cover. Diving away on the artificial mat
eased into the gap between cover and point. Gorgeous timing
gentle dab as he gets forward
slices this uppish drive to square third man
length on off, dabs behind point
length on middle and leg, whipped to deep square
defended from the crease towards point
balance and timing impeccable as he flicks this into the gap at midwicket
nice and full on off, driven to mid-off
copy book forward defence to a full delivery on the stumps
back of length outside off, left alone
got too close to the pitch as he turned this to short midwicket
looks to tickle it fine but is defeated by the inward movement, wide called
defended with soft hands
close to the stumps on a length, blocked again.
swivels and pulls all along the ground to deep square
slants one across on a length, left alone
stands tall and punches wide of mid-off
too short, sliding down and he pulls him imperiously in front of square. Sat up nicely
huge appeal for lbw as he gets this to hit the pad off the pitch. But the height may have saved Campbell
plays forward, beaten by the length.
squeezes this attempted square drive to the covers, there was width on offer, but he got too close to the pitch of the delivery
stands tall and bunts this length delivery into the off side
nearly dragged this back onto the stumps! Went for an extra cover drive, but got a thick inside edge onto the pad
shapes to drive, but decides to leave
defends outside the line to get a thick inside edge onto the pad again
gets this to nip away off the seam, left alone
length ball on the stumps, worked into the leg side
pulled but no timing, straight to short midwicket
lands short of mid-on, was looking to clear the infield, but ended up hitting it flat.
worked neatly off his hip to deep backward square
goes full and straight, a cutter this time, defended back
swivels back and pulls him all along the ground to beat the fine leg fielder
high full toss, flat-batted over long-off. Sails all the way. Aleem Dar deems this too high and well above the waist, so a free hit is coming up
belts this full toss to mid-off
short but angling into the body, he hops across and tickles it fine. Fine leg fielder does well to move swiftly but loses it in trying to recover to throw.
gorgeous extra cover drive. This was overpitched and asking to be hit, Hope did just that
half-stop at extra cover gives away a run
reaches out and drives crisply to sweeper cover
this one keeps a touch low but he's right behind the line in defence
length on middle, punched to mid-on
crisply driven wide of mid-off for a quick single
slants one down leg, helped along to fine leg for a couple
length on middle and leg, worked past square leg, the man in the deep had quite some work to do
defended back
defended from the crease
length ball angling in, defended
punched past extra cover
pushed to mid-off
hint of width outside off, eased to square third man
good stop off his own bowling, this was driven back hard
firm push to mid-off, saved a couple of runs there
length on middle and leg, tucked to deep square leg
bunts this gently into the off side, looks for a quick single but point swoops in to stop.
square driven to point, good stop
works this wide of midwicket
stands tall and punches to cover
left alone, there was an open invitation to drive
steered down to square third man
pulled nicely but he was hitting it towards the longer boundary, good running
looks to whip this through midwicket but gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as this rolls to the leg side
sweetly timed square drive to deep point
worked to long leg
defended back with soft hands
slower and fuller on off, defended back
length on off, this one holds onto the surface, looked to punch but it this back off the inner half of the bat
went for an ugly heave, but misses. Huge appeal for lbw but not given. Was this slipping down. Very, very close.
paddled round the corner, fetched this from outside off
squeezes this yorker to cover
eases to square third man for an easy single
slow flight outside off, steps out and clips with the turn to the right of long-on
shorter now, rocks back and swats it down to long-on once more
full, angling into middle and leg, driven back to the bowler
nice flight, angling in towards off stump and dipping slightly on Hope as he stretches out to defend. Goes on with the angle and takes the inside edge, rolls gently into the leg side
floats this up outside off stump and Campbell throws his hands at the drive. Ends up slicing it in the air, but wide of the man at backward point
fired in quicker on off stump. Stays in the crease and bunts it gently into the point region
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, leans back and taps it down to third man
fullish, angling in towards off stump, gets on the front foot and pushes into the covers
gently floated across the stumps, stretches forward to lap-sweep and misses, but gets a bit of pad on it down into the short fine leg region
back of a length close to off stump, goes back and across to clip to mid-on
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs towards backward point. Loud shout of 'no!' as the fielder closes the ball down
shot! That's overpitched, angling into off stump, and Hope gets his front pad away from the line and brings his bat down perfectly vertical to send the ball running away past the bowler's right foot
back of a length outside off, keeps a touch low. Goes back and across and punches into the cover point region
fired in flat, back of a length on off, punched to the left of the sweeper at deep cover point to bring up the century stand
tossed up slow and just outside off, errs by landing this a touch too full, and Hope gets on the front foot and hoicks it away over mid-on to bring up his fifty
back of a length, the ball goes with the angle towards off stump, punched into the covers
back of a length once again, a little straighter, punched down to long-on
nicely bowled, dangled up outside off and it dips on Campbell as he lunges out to defend. Pitches and goes on with the angle rather than turning in, and it slides past the outside edge
full, angling into the stumps, and a big lbw shout as Hope closes his bat face early to try and work it leg side. It hits the back of the bat, in fact, and runs away to the third man boundary
angles this one into the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
length ball angling away from off stump, stays back and jabs towards backward point
short, a bit of width, chopped away to deep point and Campbell now brings up his fifty. It's his first in ODIs
back of a length, angling down leg. Misses the flick and the ball hits his pad and drops a short distance away into the leg side. Quick call from both ends, and they complete the quick single easily
full on off stump, and mid-off is just about deep enough for Campbell to call for the single after punching the ball towards him
tossed up not too far outside off, Campbell looks for the fine reverse-sweep and misses
second time in two overs, he's beaten by lack of turn as he pushes forward to defend this nicely flighted ball outside off stump
tossed up again, gets closer to the pitch now and drives to long-off

flat, angling into middle stump, and that's a super shot. It wasn't short, but he goes deep in the crease to create a bit of shortness, and brings his wrists into play to whip it to the boundary to the left of deep square leg
onto the pads now, clipped to deep square leg
fired down leg, Hope misses the flick
tossed up on off stump, nice stride forward to push to long-off
short outside off, gets up on his toes to slap to deep point

lbw appeal as Campbell stretches across to lap-sweep. The angle from over the wicket would make it too difficult to get lbws against the left-hander. On this occasion it might have pitched in line, but it was angling away from off stump
on the pads, tucked away to long leg
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to guide this to the right of third man
back of a length on leg stump, worked down to fine leg
back of a length outside off, uses his wrists to clip that to mid-on

down the track to the flighted ball close to off stump, gets too close to the pitch of it to loft it, so he drives along the ground instead, towards mid-off, where a bit of bad bounce confounds Kevin O'Brien. The ball runs away past the fielder's left foot and all the way for four
shorter now, slapped to the right of deep point
back of a length outside off, stops on Campbell slightly as he rocks onto the back foot. Jabbed to deep point
tossed up now, angling in towards off stump. Hope pushes forward to defend, playing for non-existent turn, and ends up inside-edging into the leg side
a lot more flight now, wider outside off, driven to the right of sweeper cover
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across to clip into the leg side
short, a bit of width, and Hope stands tall to force it away to the right of deep cover point
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on
wide half-volley, so much width, and Hope gets forward and brings those wrists into play once more to drive to the left of extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
ooh, a bit of extra bounce there, and nips away off the seam too. Shortish outside off, and Hope is beaten as he tries to stab it towards point
full, angling down leg.  Big lbw appeal as Campbell plants his front foot and misses the big leg-side whip
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs into the point region
length ball on middle stump, clipped to the right of midwicket
slower bouncer over off stump, Campbell shapes to hook and then decides to drop his wrists and evade it. The ball bounces loopily and then rolls down towards keeper Wilson, who fumbles to allow a bye
full outside off, gets on the front foot and opens his face to guide to point
full again, gets forward, initially looking for the cover drive, but the ball stops on him and he turns his wrists to push to the right of mid-off instead
starts with a wide, ends up whanging this back-of-a-length ball waaay outside off stump
shortish, angling into leg stump, pulled to deep backward square leg
back of a length on the legs, tucked away to deep square leg
full on off stump, pushed to mid-on
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover to bring up West Indies' 150
another wide, this time down the leg side, past the attempted whip-pull, and Wilson throws himself to his right to collect it
length ball angling away and offering quite a bit of width. Campbell slaps it away powerfully, to the left of the diving Balbirnie at cover
on the pads now, clipped to deep square leg
bam. Length ball angling into off stump, and Campbell clears his front leg and launches this high over the wide long-on boundary
back of a length on off stump, jabbed away to the left of backward point
back of a length, angling across to off stump, jumps across and whips it to deep square leg
short, angling down leg, and Campbell swivels to hook it to the right of fine leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards short extra-cover
back of a length, angling down leg, Campbell can't put bat to ball with that leg glance
shortish outside off, nice use of the hands to steer it through point
full, lots of width, Hope flows forward to drive to the left of extra-cover, and he leaves the sweeper with no chance of cutting it off to his right
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and uses the pace to guide it to third man
he loves that shot. Length ball angling across to off stump, and he stretches forward and across to lap-sweep. Fine leg is far too square to have a chance
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball on middle stump, worked away to the left of midwicket
digs this in, gets it up to around shoulder height just outside off. Rolls his wrists nicely over the hook to keep it along the ground, down to long leg
shortish outside off, flat-batted down to mid-off, who's right on the edge of the circle
flat, fired into the pads, clipped to backward square leg
full, close to off stump, driven back to the bowler
fired into the pads again, clipped to the left of midwicket
flat length ball on off stump. Stays back and punches towards midwicket
a touch wider, punched to sweeper cover

full outside off, stretches forward and drives to cover, where a misfield from Dockrell allows the batsmen to scamper a single. Dockrell took his eye off the ball as he grabbed too early at the ball, and then as he tried to scramble and recover, he ended up twisting his ankle a little
back of a length outside off, guided down to third man
length ball close to off stump, presses forward and pushes gently into the covers
back of a length, angling into middle stump, tucked to the right of midwicket
full on off stump, driven to the left of mid-off
full, not too far outside off, again that beautiful big stride and straight bat into Hope's drive, to the left of the diving Dockrell at short extra
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a bit straighter now, driven down to long-on
nice length on off stump, gets forward and blocks with the turn into the on side
fuller, clipped to the right of midwicket, who makes the diving stop
a touch shorter, punched down to long-on
tossed up just outside off, driven down to long-off
shortish outside leg, helped along to fine leg
punched back, grazes the stumps at the other end, mid-on stops it
driven firmly to sweeper cover to raise West Indies' second 200-run opening stand in ODIs
back of length on middle and leg, tucked behind square for an easy single
cutter that jags away to square him up, lovely ball
driven firmly to thread the gap at extra cover. Superb, so sweet.
works this to midwicket
nicely tossed up, he defends with the spin into the leg side
flatter trajectory, he goes back and across to defend
thick edge, rolls past the vacant slip cordon. Deflected off the keeper's gloves
eases this tossed up delivery to short cover
slider from around the stumps, he defends from the crease.
attempted scoop, deflects off the body and a hint of bat to short fine leg
crunches this drive to mid-off for a quick single
steered to square third man
looks to tap and run but cover point swoops in quickly to prevent it. Nerves, nerves.

what a way to get to your century! This is nice and full and Hope shows the full face to lace this back the ground. Knew it was four once it bisected mid-on and mid-off. Arms out, soaks in the applause, puts his helmet back on. Fifth ODI century for him
on the pads, flicked firmly into the gap at midwicket for a couple
works this with the spin to long-on, his maiden ODI century Campbell is elated as is the rest of the team in the dug out. It's cold but they're all out in the gallery to applaud. Solid knock.
swept to short fine
eased down to long-on

goes big and connects, the slog sweep but struck it so very well. Got underneath the flight and allowed his muscle to do the rest. Flat hit, no chance for deep midwicket even though he wasn't far from the ball
steps out and eases this down to long-on
rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
belts this full toss to cover
slips this way outside off, wide called and rightly so
whips this to deep square leg

deceived by the back-of-the-hand slower delivery, there's bounce on this as he lands it a touch short, Campbell was winding up to go big but had to change his shot and ended up bunting it into the off side. Because the bat was so close to the pad, the fielders went up in an appeal. Not given
just eludes Porterfield at mid-on! Sees it in his half and goes big to clear the man.
punched back past the bowler
slower and fuller on the stumps, kept out
length ball on middle and leg, whipped to deep square leg
too short and spanked! Made room and swung it over deep square. Hit the bang middle as it sailed away. They're searching for the ball as it landed in one of the bushes.
excellent comeback, effort ball, banged in and rose sharply. Campbell beaten for pace
chops this on the bounce to the keeper.
slips this into the pads, tucked to fine le
stands tall and punches to sweeper cover
beaten by a cutter, looked to steer it behind square
through with the pull even before the ball arrived. He dragged the length short, was there to hit though
slaps this to mid-off, they scamper a single
works this down to long-on
slower and fuller on the stumps and he's lofted it cleanly over extra cover
chops this wide of cover
belts this on the up to wide mid-off
slaps this to wide long-on, too short and he's lucky to get away with it
slower and fuller outside off, driven to sweeper cover
a direct hit at the bowler's end and Campbell was gone
slower ball gone wrong, looks to sweep but too far down leg side.
fetches this pull from outside off, on the bounce to deep square leg
whaddayplaya! His straight hits are something else, gushes my colleague Varun Shetty. I agree. This is full, he makes room and tees off like a golfer
cuts, gets a thick outside edge to third man
not quite timed well, but he'll still get a boundary, one bounce four. This is a length ball, he backs away and goes straight. Hit very well
gone! Dispatched. This was banged in, sat up nicely and he whacked it with all his might to clear deep midwicket
slips out of his hand, was looking to reverse sweep, misses but it's a free-hit
caught at long-off, but he has to hurl the ball back
drilled back past the bowler! This is a length ball, he backed away and flat-batted it
too short, fetches this from outside off and muscles it one bounce to the deep midwicket
full toss on middle and he's muscled this one bounce over the ropes. Long-on ran in a tad too much
rocks back and pulls all along the ground to deep midwicket
full toss outside off and he backs away and creams this through extra cover
slider on middle and leg, tucked it towards deep midwicket
gets to the pitch of the ball, goes high and handsome, just clears long-on. This is a super hit. Short straight boundary and he deposited this deep into the stands.
squeezed back to the bowler.
the wheel are truly coming off now, this is quickly turning into stick cricket madness! Slower ball, too short and Hope stayed still and muscled this one bounce to the long-on boundary
through with the heave even before the ball arrived, wide called.
short ball on middle, misses again. Played very early
belted one bounce to long-on
backs away and slices this shortish delivery to deep point for a couple
whips this into the gap at deep midwicket
helped along to fine leg, brings up the 150
swatted disdainfully to split deep midwicket and deep square leg
slower ball, through with the pull even before the ball arrived. On the bounce to the keeper.
controlled half-pull to fine leg
sees the batsman backing away and goes full and wide, now he tries to squeeze this behind point and misses.
blind slogging this, deceived by the slower ball. Misses
slips in a wide ball down leg, Hope looking to pull but missed
wallops the pull to Dockrell at deep midwicket
mistimed heave to deep midwicket
slower and fuller on the stumps, drilled to long-off
don't bother trying to catch that, sails way over the sightscreen. Could've taken away the TV cameras on the makeshift stand above the sightscreen
swings north, ball goes south. Wild slash, gets a thick outside edge past the keeper to the third man boundary
swing and a miss. Looked to slog from way outside off
thick edge again, slashed so hard but there's no one at slip and third man
slips this slower delivery down leg, left alone but they scamper a bye as the keeper fumbles
walks across to loft this over cover point, but misses
reaches out to squeeze this behind point, beaten
squeezes this down to long-on
drills this to long-off for a quick single
mistimes this hoick to midwicket
short ball on middle and leg, muscled into the gap at deep backward square leg, one bounce over the ropes
mistimed hoick to deep square
this is magnificent. Pure class, pay any money to watch him! Gets down on one knee, gets underneath the length and lofts him cleanly to clear deep cover. Pristine. Held his pose for the cameras
fine leg was under this swirler, but McCarthy was late to get off the blocks and so lets this through. Good effort nonetheless
backs away and frees his arms to get the free swing, walloped to midwicket
makes room and drills this full delivery to sweeper cover
slaps this length ball up and over cover
short on leg, he gets inside the line and pulls it all along the ground to deep square
reaches out and slaps this one bounce to deep point
backs away to upper cut but misses
there's the wicket, finally. Porterfield calls at mid-off, runs in and latches on. Campbell backed away to flat-bat this but got a top-edge. End of a magnificent innings
top-edges this pull, sails over the keeper's head
swing and a miss
he's hit this down the throat of deep square leg. Too short, fetched it from outside off, hit well but the fielder didn't have to move an inch.
plays inside the line of this slower bouncer as he lets it go
slower and fuller on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
slower length ball outside off, through with the pull but misses
bunts this full toss into the gap at cover
slapped one bounce to long-on
play and a miss, was through with the swing even before the ball arrived
heave and a miss, hit on the body
dug in short, Darren ducks under this one. Surprised? I am
one-handed pull into the gap at deep midwicket
slower ball but gets the direction wrong as he slips this down leg, wide called
pulls and misses, played too early and was nowhere near the ball
flicked down to fine leg
beaten as he looks to back away and slap this over cover, bowled just outside the wide line

hit straight, hit high but can't clear the ropes as Kevin O'Brien takes a dolly at long-off. West Indies end with the highest ODI score in Ireland, surpassing the previous best of 379. Ireland have taken four hours to bowl their quota, having been made to run ragged. They must be exhausted in the cold. Let's see how they'll approach the chase when we get underway in 40 minutes. Do join us then.
welcome, Mr Cottrell. This is a gentle length ball that has been wristed behind square, the timing so beautiful that the ball raced across the turf. Lovely start
beaten on the drive. Full and swinging away, threw his hands at that
clobbered! Swings this length delivery with all his might, one bounce to deep backward square leg
short of length on middle and leg, tucked behind square. There's no fine leg
looks to drive but gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
punched on the up but this is a good stop at point.
bowled him! This is a harmless length ball angling in, Stirling with a feeble push but plays down the wrong line. Sees the ball beat the outside edge to smash into the stumps.
jags back in a long way to hit him on the box. What a welcome first ball . He's down, wincing in pain.
gets half-forward and bunts this delivery back down the pitch
fails to keep this down but picks the gap at midwicket
squirts this off a thick outside edge to third man
right behind the line to keep it out
full toss that he's square driven to point
lifter that hustles him for pace and hits him on the stomach. Balbirnie rooted to the crease
slips this length ball on midwicket
square driven on the up, lovely timing. Nothing wrong with the delivery though. Not much swing
works this off his pads to midwicket
punches his into the covers
steps out to tickle it fine but the ball was slanted back in a long way
beaten but this is too far wide outside off. Looked to loft over cover
stands tall and bunts this into the covers
beauty! Left him late. Poke and a miss

excellent catch back-pedalling from short fine leg! Sheldon Cottrell got under this top-edge as Porterfield tried to heave into the leg side, wasn't the length to pull, and the top-edge has been pouched superbly.
back of a length outside off, left alone
overbalanced as he looks to work this through square leg, hit high on the thigh pad
driven firmly to cover point
play and a miss. Angled across to invite the poke. Good bowling

he's a dead duck! Misses a straight length ball that pitched on leg stump. He was playing across the line when he was better off going straight. Aleem Dar had absolutely no hesitation in giving that out. Ireland in tatters
authoritative forward push as he defends
late inswing, turns into a yorker-length delivery, kept out
slips this length ball outside off, left alone
nudges it to the leg side, on the bounce to short midwicket
firm push to extra cover where a half-stop results in a single
gets on top of the bounce and defends
defends with the bat close to his body
goes right back and across as he defends.
punched on the up and into the gap at extra cover
defended on the up to extra cover
stands tall and bunts this into the leg side
cries of catch but this was hit all along the ground towards midwicket
shapes back in from middle, carefully defended with the swing to short midwicket
delightful off drive, all class and elegance. By no means a half-volley, this was just a gentle push. Superb timing
turns this gently into the leg side
driven firmly to cover
leading edge but just wide of point, races away but excellent work by Carter running back
allows this length ball to slide in as he defends from the crease
turns this length ball on middle to midwicket
worked into the leg side, past the short midwicket fielder.
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends
looks to punch on the up, but this was a cutter that held on to the surface
lobs off the pad to slip. This length ball pitched way outside leg
slower ball on the stumps, defended from the crease
slower and fuller on the stumps, pushed to mid-off as they scamper a single. A direct hit from Ambris at the bowler's end and he would've been gone
crunching cover drive! Planted forward and simply hit through the line without a trace of worry
driven firmly but straight to extra cover
chipped but one bounce to mid-off
through with the pull even before this short ball arrived, hit on the right shoulder
turns this full delivery to mid-on
beats this incoming delivery that keeps a touch low, he played inside the line
squirts this off a thick edge to short third man
easy pickings, sliding down and he tickles it to the fine leg boundary
plays a short-arm jab to midwicket
dabs this from the crease into the off side
driven back but straight to mid-on
this is a beautiful shot! Driven on the up to pierce the gap between cover and mid-off. Didn't try to overhit the ball. Just pure timing
tucked to square leg, rolls off the pad. There was a stifled appeal
pulled and pulled so very well that the man at deep square leg, who had to run around to get there, was simply a mere spectator as this sailed over the ropes.
defends this short of length delivery to cover
misses a full ball but this may have been angling down.
eases this down to mid-on for a quick single
stands tall and punches this between cover and point
hit on the body as this jags back in, rolls into the off side and they sneak in a leg bye
good leave to a lifer from outside off
yorker length, late on it. Beaten
gentle little push into the off side as they scamper a single
sneaks back in off a length to hit him high on the right thigh
gets on top of the bounce and defends
defended from the crease again
thuds into the helmet as he shapes to pull, lobs to short cover. Wanted to pull but was beaten for pace. Bowled wrell over 90 miles an hour. Balbirnie is a bit shaken
driven on the up to cover point
gets half a stride in and blocks
works this square into the gap at deep square leg
defended from the crease
gentle nudge towards deep square for an easy single
pushed back down the pitch
climbs into this extra cover drive, hits it into the gap well
sneaks back in to beat the inside edge and hit him on the pad.
looks to work this behind square, misses.
keeps out this full delivery on the stumps
nudged gently from the crease
hustled for pace, is on the hop as he defends into the leg side
slants one down, too far that the keeper can't get there despite a dive
ducks under this short ball without a hassle. Ireland have arrested the collapse but aren't anywhere near the asking rate.
nice length, angling in towards off stump, gets on the front foot to push to the left of short extra-cover
shortish, angling into the hips, can't connect with the glance, but gets a tickle off his body down to fine leg
full, angling in towards middle and leg, gets forward to clip through backward square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defends and the ball slides off the inside half of the bat towards square leg
length ball angling in towards off stump, gets on the front foot to defend, takes his bottom hand off the handle to account for the extra bounce
again, angling in towards the top of off stump. This time he stays on the back foot and defends towards mid-off
full, angling in from wide of the crease. Pushes at it without too much feet, manages to play it along the ground towards mid-on
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball to dab towards backward point
length ball angling in towards off stump, gets on the front foot for a push down the ground - he hits it perfectly straight and hits the middle stump at the other end
goes wide of the crease, bangs it in short and gets it to rise towards Wilson's back shoulder. Hooks while taking his eyes off the ball, manages to middle it and keep it down to the man at long leg
short again, angling into the body. Ducks at the waist to get under it. The umpire signals no-ball, but a tiny part of his heel seems to be behind the crease
short, angling in towards leg stump, and this time O'Brien had already taken a step away towards the leg side. Gives him the room to swing his arms and club it high over midwicket
stays back to a full ball on middle stump, clips towards midwicket, and there should have been no runs for it, but an overthrow at the non-striker's end gives away two
shortish, angling into off stump, pulled round to long leg
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended to mid-on
length ball, attacking the top of off again. Gets forward to defend, goes to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
back of a length close to off stump, straightens a touch. Gets across to defend into the point region
back of a length, angling into middle and off, uses the angle to tuck it away through square leg
fuller outside off, leans forward and pushes to cover
full, angling in towards middle stump, clipped through backward square leg
full outside off, nice stretch forward to drive through cover point
length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a touch shorter, angling into off stump, stays back and punches back to the bowler

another blow to the helmet, and the neck protector goes flying. Apart from the pace, the angle from wide of the crease makes Gabriel a really awkward bowler to handle. O'Brien swivels to hook and the ball hits him flush on the helmet grille. Runs given - not sure he got any bat or glove on that
short in the corridor outside off, jumps up to ride the bounce and steer it down to third man
fullish outside off, gets a good stride forward to push to mid-off
length ball angling into middle stump, leans forward to clip towards midwicket
short, angling into leg stump, pulled to deep square leg
length ball angling into leg stump, a bit of extra bounce, defended towards midwicket
short ball rising over leg stump. O'Brien gets smartly across and helps it over the leaping keeper. Was trying to hook, and ended up gloving it finer than intended
four more. Short again, angling into leg stump and only getting up to about waist height. Swivels nicely and rolls his wrists over to pull to the backward square leg boundary
nicely done. Loopy low full-toss on leg stump, and that's quick hands from Wilson to reverse-lap it to the left of short third man
flat length ball angling down leg, clipped to backward square leg
there's the outswinging arm ball on off stump. Looks to push into the covers and gets a thickish outside edge through point
flat and full, angling into leg stump, clipped to short fine leg
full outside off, driven towards extra-cover, who dives right to stop it
full flighted ball on middle stump, looks to clip down to long-on and midwicket dives left to intercept

fullish on off stump, shows the full face to push it back down the ground, between the stumps at the other end and the non-striker. They think of a single as mid-on runs to his left, but decide against it
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended into the on side
length ball angling into middle and leg, clipped round to fine leg
in the blockhole on off stump, defended towards mid-on
bouncer angling down leg, looks to hook but doesn't connect
short ball rises to chest height on off stump. Jumps up to ride the bounce and dab it behind square on the off side
short ball gets up to shoulder height just outside off, pulls in the air, but it doesn't carry as far as the fielder moving to his left from deep square leg
big step down the track to the flighted ball on leg stump, drives down to long-on
flights it again, angling it into middle and leg, clipped to the right of midwicket
flat length ball angling into middle and leg from wide of the crease. Presses forward to defend, and inside-edges into his pad
he's been looking to angle everything into leg stump and tuck up O'Brien. Slides this quick one down the leg side, and it's swept away to the right of short fine leg to bring up fifty
again he drifts down leg, and this time O'Brien sweeps to the left of short fine leg
flighted ball on leg stump, jumps out and drills it powerfully to deep midwicket
length ball outside off. Looks to drive away from his body without really getting his front foot across, and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to try and steer to third man, and Jonathan Carter throws himself to his left at backward point to intercept
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets across to whip to fine leg
back of a length, straightens a touch towards off stump. Presses forward, lets it come on, and dabs to backward point with an open face
shortish, a bit of width, stabbed away to the right of backward point - brings up 2000 ODI runs with that shot
shortish on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball to steer it down to third man
tossed up, angling into the pads, clipped through backward square leg
flat on leg stump, goes back to work it to short fine leg
back of a length close to off stump, waits on it and taps it towards backward point
flighted ball on leg stump, swept away to deep square leg
O'Brien takes a step away towards the leg side and Nurse bowls it flat on middle stump. Reaches for it and launches it high, back over the bowler's head
flat on leg stump, clipped back to the bowler
short, angling into leg stump, pulled to the left of fine leg. Slips a little as he swivels
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to push to backward point
length ball angling into middle stump, and O'Brien isn't fully forward to flick this. Ends up flicking in the air, but it lands short of the diving midwicket fielder
length ball close to off stump, pushed into the cover point region with soft hands
length ball straightening in the fifth-stump channel. Gets a good stride forward to push into the covers
length ball on the pads, clipped to the left of long leg
down the track and he fires it flatter at his pads, nudged away through backward square leg
slower, floated across to off stump, steps out again and clips through midwicket

gone! KOB jumps out again and gets too close to the pitch of this off-stump ball. Can't get as much elevation as he wants, and only manages to pick out Holder at mid-off with his flat-bat drive, at about chest height
oh my, two in two! Fullish, angling into leg stump, and the ball seemed to stop on Wilson there. Looks to flick, checks his shot, and ends up chipping the simplest of catches to mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, waits on it and defends into the point region
short ball angling in from wide of the crease. Caught between ducking and fending, he ends up half-fending and gloving the ball towards backward point
shortish on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, hangs back and punches towards mid-off
full, angling into leg stump, clipped through backward square leg
shortish, angling down leg, pulled to short fine leg
down the track and Nurse shortens his length, clipped to long-on

big appeal as Dockrell misses the sweep, and it's given. It's plumb, the ball pitching not too far outside off and spinning back in towards middle and leg. Didn't get a big enough stride across for the impact to be outside the line either
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to short fine leg
lunges forward and flicks, midwicket dives to his right and misfields
length ball angling into off stump, hangs on the back foot and blocks into the off side
bouncer angling into the body, doesn't get up that high. Ducks down low to evade it
fullish outside off, driven to the right of deep point, and Darren Bravo shows some nifty football skills to stop it from running away for four
shortish outside off, doesn't bounce as much as expected as he looks to pull. Bottom-edges it and the keeper fumbles as it arrives to him after bouncing another time
gone. Short on off stump, and that's pulled fiercely but straight to Ambris at square leg. He takes it well with both hands, tumbling backwards on impact
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot to block
down the track and Nurse bowls it flatter and shorter. Whipped away through midwicket
back of a length, angling into the pads, worked through square leg
back of a length outside off, gets back and across to clip towards midwicket
beauty. Tossed up, drifts away slightly and carries on along that trajectory after pitching as he prods forward to defend. Beats the outside edge and nearly takes out off stump
down the track and flicks to the right of midwicket, where Carter makes a diving stop
length ball on off stump, presses forward and pushes to point
short, wide, slapped away fiercely to the left of backward point

bowled him. Takes a big step across to the off side to try and open up the fine leg region. Gabriel responds with a fast, full one at the base of middle stump, and Adair ends up bowled behind his legs
back of a length, angling into off stump, makes a lot of room and carves it away over the covers
makes room again, and ends up too far from the line of this short ball to connect with his flat-bat slap
now Gabriel follows him with a full one, and he flicks it away to deep square leg
short, angling down leg, pulled to long leg
flat on the pads, clipped through square leg
down the leg side, Murtagh misses the flick
down the track, makes a bit of room, flat-bats from outside off stump to long-on
angles into Murtagh's legs and he flicks it away to the right of long leg
makes room again to this short-of-good-length ball on off stump, swipes to mid-on
shorter now, angling down leg, pulled to long leg
full, angling away into the fifth-stump line. Throws his bat at a big cover drive and misses
slower length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
length ball angling across to off stump, lets it come on and steers to third man
shot. Down the track and Nurse floats it wider. Launched over the extra-cover region

gone! Looks to step out again and Nurse deceives him with a beaut. Nicely flighted, dips shorter than McCarthy expects as he lunges at the drive, and it grips and turns between bat and pad to present Hope with the easiest of stumpings

yikes. He's smashed Murtagh's elbow at the other end! Thankfully he's left-handed an therefore wearing an arm guard on his right arm. Down the track, gets close to the pitch of it, and smacks it hard and flat
and that's that. Shuffles across before stretching out to sweep, and he ends up getting too far across, and the ball turns past him and crashes into the exposed stumps
